Package Pieces

Class piece

java.lang.Object
Pieces.piece
Direct Known Subclasses:
bishop, emptySquare, king, knight, pawn, queen, rook
public abstract class piece
extends java.lang.Object
piece is an abstract class for all of the subclasses(knight, emptySquare, etc) to take from
Author:
Dhrishti Hazari, Jayson Pitta

  • Constructor Details

    • piece

      public piece​(java.lang.String value)
      Constructor of class
      Parameters:
      value - takes in a String value priorMove is an int that keeps track of how many movements the piece has previously made canEnPassant is an int to keep track of number of rounds and is meant for pawns to be able to tell if it is the very next round and they can EnPassant

  • Method Details

    • getValue

      public java.lang.String getValue()
      getValue gets the value of the piece has no input parameter
      Returns:
      value of piece

    • getType

      public char getType()
      getType gets the type of piece has no input parameter
      Returns:
      char type of piece('p','R','Q',etc)

    • getColor

      public char getColor()
      getColor gets the color of piece has no input parameter
      Returns:
      char color of piece('w' OR 'b')

    • getMovement

      public int getMovement()
      getMovement gets the number of moves of the piece has no input parameter
      Returns:
      an int for how many moves the piece has done

    • setMovement

      public void setMovement​(int moved)
      setMovement sets the number of moves of the piece to a specific int value
      Parameters:
      moved - is the int to set the movement of the piece to has no return value

    • getCanEnPassant

      public int getCanEnPassant()
      getCanEnPassant gets the getCanEnPassant value of the piece has no input parameter
      Returns:
      an int for the getCanEnPassant value of the piece

    • setEnPassant

      public void setEnPassant​(int value)
      setEnPassant sets the getCanEnPassant value of the piece to a specific int value
      Parameters:
      value - is the int to set the getCanEnPassant value of the piece to has no return value

    • validMove

      public boolean validMove​(position currPos, position newPos, boolean isWhite, int numTurn)
      validMove is used by the subclasses to tell if the move of the specific piece is valid or not
      Parameters:
      currPos - is the current position of the piece
      newPos - is the position the piece wants to move to
      isWhite - tells us whose turn it is(if true, white; if false, black)
      numTurn - tells us how many rounds it has been
      Returns:
      returns a boolean, true if the move is valid, false otherwise
